public class Travel
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Details

    • Travel

      public Travel()

  • Method Details

    • menu

      public void menu()
      This method is the main interface of the program. It allows the user to access the UI methods.
      pre: post: The user will be shown a list of options. The method they choose will be executed.

    • createClients

      public void createClients()
      This method allows the user to create a client by entering the respective data by console.
      pre:
      post: The client will have been created with the data specified by the user in each field. Then, the user is shown what rank the client entered belongs to.

    • loadShip

      public void loadShip()
      This method allows the used to load the ship with the specified number of cargos.
      pre: The clients have to have been created beforehand.
      post: The ship will be loaded with the cargo information entered by the user. The discounts will be applied according to the client's type and the total price for each client will be shown. The value cargosCreated will be set to true.

    • displayCargoMenu

      public void displayCargoMenu()
      This method allows the user to get the information from a specific or all cargos.
      pre: The cargo has to have been initialized with values other than empty or null.
      post: The information of the cargo or cargos selected by the user will be displayed.

    • displayCargo

      public void displayCargo​(int cargo)
      This method displays the information of the cargo specified.
      pre: The cargo has to have been initialized with values other than empty or null.
      post: The information of the cargo will be displayed
      Parameters:
      cargo - This is the position of the cargo in the array (Starts with 0).

    • displayClientMenu

      public void displayClientMenu()
      This method allows the user to get the information from a specific or all clients.
      pre: The client has to have been initialized with values other than empty or null.
      post: The information of the clent or clients selected by the user will be displayed.

    • displayClient

      public void displayClient​(int client)
      This method displays the information of the client specified.
      pre: The client has to have been initialized with values other than empty or null.
      post: The information of the client will be displayed
      Parameters:
      client - This is the position of the client in the array (Starts with 0).

    • displayShip

      public void displayShip()
      This method displays the ship's information: Total weight carried, total price of the cargo and uses checkStatus() to display whether the ship can leave port or not.
      pre: The cargo and clients have to have been initialized with values other than empty or null.
      post: The ship's information will be displayed.

    • sail

      public void sail()
      This method updates the information of the clients who currently have a cargo on the ship. This only works if the ship can leave port.
      pre: The cargo and clients have to have been initialized with values other than empty or null.
      post: The ship's information will be displayed.

    • unloadShip

      public void unloadShip​(boolean goToMenu)
      This method sets all values of the cargo to 0. It also modifies the cargosCreated flag, which indicates whether a cargo has been created.
      pre: A cargo has to have been created.
      post: The cargos array will be set to all zeroes. cargosCreated will be set to false.
      Parameters:
      goToMenu - If it is given "true" the function will activate the menu after being done.
